intro: Nonea kandaharensis, commonly known as the Kandahar nonea, is a flowering plant native to Afghanistan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, narrow leaves. Its flowers are yellow with a central disk, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
